topics.topic_html:
<sn><md class="p-1 p-md-2 my-2" data-rr="true">### **Chapters**
---

| Chapter No. | Chapter Title                       | Description                                                               |                                    |
| ----------- | ----------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------- |
| 1           | Introduction to Regex               | ðŸ‘‰ What is Regex, history, uses, and syntax overview                      |                                    |
| 2           | Basic Regex Syntax                  | ðŸ‘‰ Characters, literals, metacharacters (`.`, `^`, `$`, etc.)             |                                    |
| 3           | Character Classes                   | ðŸ‘‰ Square brackets `[ ]`, ranges, negation `[^ ]`, predefined classes     |                                    |
| 4           | Quantifiers                         | ðŸ‘‰ `*`, `+`, `?`, `{n}`, `{n,}`, `{n,m}` and their greedy/lazy versions   |                                    |
| 5           | Anchors                             | ðŸ‘‰ Start `^` and end `$` line anchors, word boundaries `\b`, `\B`         |                                    |
| 6           | Grouping and Capturing              | ðŸ‘‰ Parentheses `()`, non-capturing `(?: )`, backreferences `\1`, `\2`     |                                    |
| 7           | Alternation                         | ðŸ‘‰ Using pipe \`                                                          | \` to match one pattern or another |
| 8           | Escaping Special Characters         | ðŸ‘‰ How to use `\` to match special characters literally                   |                                    |
| 9           | Lookahead and Lookbehind Assertions | ðŸ‘‰ Positive & negative lookahead `(?= )`, `(?! )` and lookbehind `(?<= )` |                                    |
| 10          | Flags and Modifiers                 | ðŸ‘‰ Case-insensitive (`i`), multiline (`m`), global (`g`), dotall (`s`)    |                                    |
| 11          | Regex in Programming Languages      | ðŸ‘‰ Using regex in JavaScript, Python, PHP, etc.                           |                                    |
| 12          | Common Regex Patterns               | ðŸ‘‰ Email, phone, URL, IP address, date, etc.                              |                                    |
| 13          | Regex Debugging and Testing Tools   | ðŸ‘‰ Online tools, regex debuggers, and tips for testing expressions        |                                    |
| 14          | Performance Optimization            | ðŸ‘‰ Efficient regex writing, avoiding catastrophic backtracking            |                                    |
| 15          | Advanced Techniques and Tricks      | ðŸ‘‰ Recursive patterns, balancing groups, conditional expressions          |                                    |
| 16          | Real-life Projects Using Regex      | ðŸ‘‰ Log filtering, data validation, search-replace automation              |                                    |</md></sn>
